Issues.Title: Container width

Hi How to-max width div with class container is 960px? CSS: ```css @media screen and (min-width: 1000px) .is-width-960px { max-width: 960px!important; } ``` HTML: ```html
...
``` is enough?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Container width" (#2794)

Issues.Title: Columns in container not resizing appropriately
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**. I am unsure of whether or not this is a bug or my own error. It appears similarly across browsers.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.0]
My **browser** is: Chrome, Edge
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
<!-- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? -->

### Description

Columns inside of a container are not resizing appropriately, with some getting cut off. After it switches to vertical columns it appears fine; the horizontal columns appear to be the issue.
### Steps to Reproduce


1. View [https://codepen.io/agoldstein03/pen/jOEgPwL](https://codepen.io/agoldstein03/pen/jOEgPwL)
2. Resize the window and see how the columns do not resize correctly.


### Expected behavior

A centered, spaced container with equal-sized columns that fit in the container.

### Actual behavior

A not centered, only left-spaced container with non-equal-sized columns that are cut off by the right side of the screen.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Columns in container not resizing appropriately" (#2793)

Issues.Title: Unable to set pagination-item-padding-left/right
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**: 0.8.0

### Description

It seems hardcoded values are uses that overwrites the first one:
https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/sass/components/pagination.sass#L68
https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/sass/components/pagination.sass#L94

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set `$pagination-item-padding-left` and/or `$pagination-item-padding-right`
2. Final props: `padding-left: 0.75em` & `padding-right: 0.75em` instead of chosen padding

### Expected behavior

Use custom padding

### Actual behavior

Hardcoded values
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to set pagination-item-padding-left/right" (#2789)

Issues.Title: link color bug on safari
Issues.Body:
## Description On Safari only, the link color is not correctly computed when inserted in a hero with some color modifier. ## To reproduce ```
Hello world
Hello world
``` Result: | Correct behavior (Chrome) | Wrong behavior (Safari) | | --- | --- | | ![correct behavior](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/866788/73375150-aacb7700-42bb-11ea-86ab-b4798d6d6ac9.png) | ![wrong behavior](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/866788/73375151-aacb7700-42bb-11ea-9bdb-14c6b0b17a94.png) | I expect that the link color should be `$link-color` as on Chrome. ## Reason When not working (on Safari only), the following rule is triggered: https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/sass/layout/hero.sass#L24-L26 I cannot explain why this occurs only on Safari, but for sure, inheriting the color (i.e. take the parent color) cannot lead to a good result here.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "link color bug on safari" (#2785)

Issues.Title: Nitpicking: Documentation appears out of sync with source code
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **the Docs**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem
This is about the Bulma **Docs**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.0]
This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [1.25.0] (node)

### Description
According to the docs, the $hero-body-padding and its size variations are described in the docs, but not included in the source. 

in the docs: https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/hero/#variables

### Steps to Reproduce

1. include bulma sass source using (`@import node_modules/bulma/sass;`)
2. Try to use: `padding: $hero-body-padding` in custom stylesheets, it throws an error that the variable(s) are undefined. Example:

```scss
.hero {
  .hero-foot { padding: $hero-body-padding; }
}
```

3. sass cli throws error

### Expected behavior
That for assigning `padding: $hero-body-padding[-{size}]` I get the values for the body padding of a hero element. The documentation describes their availability (see link to docs above)

### Actual behavior
Throws an error that $hero-body-padding is undefined. Exact error:

```bash
Error: Undefined variable.
╷
10 │     padding: $hero-body-padding;
   │              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   ╵
  src/sass/index.scss 10:14  root stylesheet
```

### What do?
Make it available to use in custom stylesheets like the other variables. I as a user love the way of how variables are organized and even though most of the variables are available, some appear to not be available when including the bulma source in the root scss. I haven't tested this further, but this may be also happening for more described variables. A check up from the docs to the source may be a necessity.

Bug aside, I love Bulma! :) keep it up
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Nitpicking: Documentation appears out of sync with source code" (#2784)

1. Adds the [List](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/docs/documentation/components/list.html) component to the Components in Documentation (tabs, sidebar).
2. Adds the [List](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/docs/documentation/components/list.html) component to the [Alternative to Boostrap](https://bulma.io/alternative-to-bootstrap/) comparison (removing `empty` from Bulma, and `unique` from Bootstrap, and adding the component).

None. 

The component already existed; simply had to be linked in the appropriate documentation sections.

Issues.Title: Why do items inside `navbar-brand` and `navbar-menu` have to have the `navbar-item` class?
Issues.Body: It seems a bit unnecessary. As part of the ongoing effort to make Bulma more semantic, could we please rid ourselves of this requirement?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Why do items inside `navbar-brand` and `navbar-menu` have to have the `navbar-item` class?" (#2781)

Issues.Title: #2760 - Add feature for circular-progress-bar
Issues.Body:
This is a new feature for issue #2760 ### Proposed solution This is my solution for circular progress bar required into issue #2760. You can use `is-circle` with `process` class. For example: ```
``` After `is-circle` you can append all standard Bulma classes for text colors(has-text-$color), bar color(is-info, is-danger), font width(is-size-1), etc... Default size of bar is 0. You can change this size with value tag attribute `value="40"` from 0 to 100. This solution is not compatible with `` tag. ### Tradeoffs The issue reported was using the ### Testing Done Manually tested with Mozilla Firefox and Microsoft Edge. ![immagine](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10075337/72658621-bbbee300-39b3-11ea-8d7f-9cf05c2dbd16.png) ### Changelog updated? No. Any suggestions?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "#2760 - Add feature for circular-progress-bar" (#2776)

Issues.Title: Circular progress bar
Issues.Body:
This is a new feature for issue #2760 ### Proposed solution This is my solution for circular progress bar required into issue #2760. You can use `is-circle` with `process` class. For example: ```
``` After `is-circle` you can append all standard Bulma classes for text colors(has-text-$color), bar color(is-info, is-danger), font width(is-size-1), etc... Default size of bar is 0. You can change this size with class `is-$dimension` from 0 to 100. This solution is not compatible with `` tag. ### Tradeoffs The issue reported was using the ### Testing Done Manually tested with Mozilla Firefox ### Changelog updated? No. Any suggestions?

Issues.Title: Fixes #2773 - Import derived-variables in mixins.scss
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **bugfix** for #2773 .

### Proposed solution

Import the derived-variables in mixins.scss too.
This will ensure you don't get compiler errors when you only need to import mixins.scss.

### Tradeoffs

None. The dependency to the derived-variables stylesheet was already there (see original issue), this only makes that dependency explicit and prevents compiler errors.

### Testing Done

I have tested this change against the how-to-reproduce in #2773 . Without this change, I get a compiler error. With this change I don't.

<!-- BEFORE SUBMITTING YOUR PR, MAKE SURE TO FOLLOW THESE STEPS: -->
<!-- 1. Pull the latest `master` branch -->
<!-- 2. Make sure your Sass code is compliant with the [Bulma Sass styleguide](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#bulma-sass-styleguide) -->
<!-- 3. Make sure your PR only affects `.sass` or documentation files -->

<!-- How have you confirmed this feature works? -->
<!-- Please explain more than "Yes". -->

No.

<!-- Thanks! -->

Issues.Title: Mixins.scss uses un-imported variables.
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.8.0
This is a **Sass** issue.
I am _almost_ sure this issue is **not a duplicate**.

### Description

<!-- Description of the bug, enhancement, or question -->
[Utilities/mixins.scss](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/sass/utilities/mixins.sass) includes`@import "initial-variables"` in order to resolve the variables used in the various defined mixins. However, version 0.8.0 includes a mixin (=delete) that makes use of the `$scheme-invert` variable, while it is not specified in the included initial-variables.scss .

This will cause a problem if you only import the mixins, because the `$scheme-invert` variable will be undefined. 

### Steps to Reproduce

- Create a new .scss file
- Import the mixins.scss from Bulma (e.g. `@import "./node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/mixins";`)
- compile the .scss file you created above.

### Expected behavior

No compilation errors.

### Actual behavior

I got a compiler error:
```
{
  "status": 1,
  "file": "../node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/mixins.sass",
  "line": 173,
  "column": 26,
  "message": "Undefined variable: \"$scheme-invert\".",
  "formatted": "Error: Undefined variable: \"$scheme-invert\".\n        on line 173 of node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/mixins.sass, in mixin `delete`\n        from line 236 of node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/mixins.sass\n        from line 1 of src/base/mixins.scss\n        from line 4 of src/base/all.scss\n>>   background-color: rgba($scheme-invert, 0.2);\n\n   -------------------------^\n"
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mixins.scss uses un-imported variables." (#2773)

Issues.Title: What is the opposite of is-hidden-mobile ?
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. 
It is a feature/question or I need help.

### Overview of the problem
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **0.8.0**
My **browser** is: Chrome & Safari
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description
I need to reorganize my content based on a mobile phone vs something larger (tablet or desktop).

As a result, I have
 1. a div that needs to display only for mobiles, and
 2. another div that needs to display only when not a mobile.

For 2, there is `is-hidden-mobile`, but what should I do for 1?  I tried using `is-mobile` but that didn't work.  Should there be a `mobile-only` class?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "What is the opposite of is-hidden-mobile ?" (#2771)

Issues.Title: Remove .DS_Store artifacts from library uploaded to unpkg
Issues.Body:
Using Libman to handle Client-Side Libraries in Visual Studio 2019 for Windows (have tried in both 16.5.0 Preview 1 and 16.4.0 both with same error), you get an error when downloading these from unpkg, as Libman cannot download the `.DS_Store` files for the library.

These files are located in:

`/sass/.DS_Store`

`/sass/utilities/.DS_Store`

With these included in the release, you have to manually specify which sass files to download, which means more maintenance should more features be added using additional sass files.

As these are not relevant to the functionality of Bulma, I would suggest excluding these from the deployment process.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove .DS_Store artifacts from library uploaded to unpkg" (#2770)

Issues.Title: Negative margin on columns causes overflow on mobile
Issues.Body:
Since #449 has been closed for 2 years, I'm making this new issue to track the problem. There was a fix for #449 but it was reverted the same day, and the problem appears to persist since. Minimalish reproduction: ``` Hello Bulma!
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.
``` On Chrome devtools the left of the text is cut off. I might be misusing this, but given by the history of 449 I assume I'm not.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Negative margin on columns causes overflow on mobile" (#2769)

Issues.Title: Enhancement: Dart Package (Code Included)
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma** | the Docs.

### Overview
We would like to make the devs aware that we have published an unofficial [Dart package](https://pub.dev/packages/bulma) and will automatically update it as upstream Bulma changes.

- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
- I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.0] 
- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description
We are using Bulma in our Dart web applications and have recently published [ibexio/dart-bulma](https://github.com/ibexio/dart-bulma). Currently the project converts to scss but it would be trivial to also include the sass and css versions. 

### Question
Are the Bulma devs ok with this and If so what else should we support to ensure we are providing a service to the community.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enhancement: Dart Package (Code Included)" (#2768)

Issues.Title: [REQUEST] Fully styled checkboxes
Issues.Body: Like https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_css_custom_checkbox.asp or similar. Cheers!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[REQUEST] Fully styled checkboxes" (#2767)

Issues.Title: Bulma source map is pointing to wrong file
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.
This is a bug regarding Bulma's source map.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.0]
My **browser** is: Latest Chrome
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

The source map shown when inspecting element almost always leads to wrong file. This makes the source map become *useless*. Because we have nothing to do with the information provided when inspecting elements.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download official Bulma or bulma-scss via npm
2. Write some layout
3. Inspect it and check information provided from parsed sourcemap

### Expected behavior

Source map information should be helpful, lead to related file.

### Actual behavior

The information provided from parsed source map leads to wrong file.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bulma source map is pointing to wrong file" (#2766)

Issues.Title: Add variables for `dropdown-item` and `navbar-item` padding
Issues.Body:
This is a feature request for Bulma.

Would love to see some additional variables for `dropdown-item` and `navbar-item` padding (especially top and bottom as currently I think it's too small).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add variables for `dropdown-item` and `navbar-item` padding" (#2765)
